verses.kjv: O Lord God, to whom vengeance belongeth; O God, to whom vengeance belongeth, shew thyself.
verses.ct: LORD God, you are the one who repays justice! God, you are the one who repays justice — reveal yourself!

verses.kjv: Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth: render a reward to the proud.
verses.ct: Rise up, Judge of the earth! Give the arrogant what they deserve.

verses.kjv: LORD, how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked triumph?
verses.ct: LORD, how long will the wicked — how long will the wicked celebrate?

verses.kjv: How long shall they utter and speak hard things? and all the workers of iniquity boast themselves?
verses.ct: How long will they pour out arrogant words? How long will all these evildoers brag about themselves?

verses.kjv: They break in pieces thy people, O LORD, and afflict thine heritage.
verses.ct: They crush your people, LORD, and oppress those who belong to you.

verses.kjv: They slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless.
verses.ct: They kill widows and foreigners and murder orphans.

verses.kjv: Yet they say, The LORD shall not see, neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.
verses.ct: And still they say, 'The LORD doesn't see it. The God of Jacob doesn't even notice.'

verses.kjv: Understand, ye brutish among the people: and ye fools, when will ye be wise?
verses.ct: Pay attention, you senseless people! You fools — when will you ever learn?

verses.kjv: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? he that formed the eye, shall he not see?
verses.ct: The one who designed the ear — can he not hear? The one who formed the eye — can he not see?

verses.kjv: He that chastiseth the heathen, shall not he correct? he that teacheth man knowledge, shall not he know?
verses.ct: The one who disciplines nations — won't he punish? The one who gives humanity knowledge — doesn't he know everything?

verses.kjv: The LORD knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.
verses.ct: The LORD knows human thoughts — he knows they are meaningless.

verses.kjv: Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O LORD, and teachest him out of thy law;
verses.ct: How fortunate is the person you discipline, LORD, the one you instruct from your law,

verses.kjv: That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity, until the pit be digged for the wicked.
verses.ct: giving them relief during times of trouble, while a pit is being dug for the wicked.

verses.kjv: For the LORD will not cast off his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.
verses.ct: The LORD will not abandon his people; he will never walk away from those who belong to him.

verses.kjv: But judgment shall return unto righteousness: and all the upright in heart shall follow it.
verses.ct: Justice will once again be carried out with righteousness, and everyone with an honest heart will embrace it.

verses.kjv: Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? or who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?
verses.ct: Who will stand with me against those who do evil? Who will take my side against those who practice wickedness?

verses.kjv: Unless the LORD had been my help, my soul had almost dwelt in silence.
verses.ct: If the LORD had not been my help, I would have quickly ended up in the silence of death.

verses.kjv: When I said, My foot slippeth; thy mercy, O LORD, held me up.
verses.ct: When I said, 'I'm losing my footing,' your mercy, LORD, kept me from falling.

verses.kjv: In the multitude of my thoughts within me thy comforts delight my soul.
verses.ct: When anxious thoughts overwhelm me, your comfort brings joy to my soul.

verses.kjv: Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with thee, which frameth mischief by a law?
verses.ct: Can a corrupt government be your ally — one that uses laws to create injustice?

verses.kjv: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood.
verses.ct: They band together against the lives of righteous people and condemn the innocent to death.

verses.kjv: But the LORD is my defence; and my God is the rock of my refuge.
verses.ct: But the LORD is my fortress, and my God is the rock where I find safety.

verses.kjv: And he shall bring upon them their own iniquity, and shall cut them off in their own wickedness; yea, the LORD our God shall cut them off.
verses.ct: He will turn their own evil back on them and destroy them through their own wickedness. The LORD our God will destroy them.
